body.p:
Campbellsburge Ky.
25th Octr AD 1863
Governor Thomas E. Brambette
Dear sir

I inclose you Mr. Matthew McCollister pertions for to obtain your remittance of his fine of $250. I have known McCollister for upwards of Thirty three years, and Know him to be all that his pettition represents him to be. I have been his Family Physician for more than Twenty five years, his wife has been confined to her bed & House more than one third of that time, with incuriable disease, he is poor and barryly makes out to live with all of his industry & frugallaty, and to have the above amount to pay would compell him to sell a part of his plantation in the Hills of Trimble County. When Mr. C Scott & my self

were in Frankfort two weeks agoe we paid Mr. J. L. Scott Prosecuting Atty. Fifty dollars in full of his Fee connecting with the fine his Fee was about $75.00 and believeing it would be opprisive he took $50, which we advanced. The subscribers to the Petition cirtafying the respectabillaty of the witnesses to the conversation which induced MCCollister to assault Horton are all good & True men: which I will refer you to Mr. Thomas Rodman as he is well acquainted with the most of them. and for my character I refer you to Gen Jno M Harlan, A G Hodges & L. Rodman. If you remitt the fine please direct it to McCollister or myself at Campbellsburge Henry Cty. Ky.

I remain as ever your devoted & personal & Political Friend
James Gurlee M. D.
